Weird

Hi team, I'm Manuel, backend developer for <http://rumi.ai|rumi.ai> . We're building an integration with HubSpot, but I'm experiencing a bug while connecting our app to our test developer account.
Is a channel where I can find support?

Aside from the HubSpot known issue, when I see this it's often because the VPN someone is using has gone walkabouts and they've forgotten about it.

Sites like HubSpot quite often have localisations set on your region and even if you have browser language settings set up, if you're using certain adblockers it can just prevent the tracking of site references and voila! Now you're reading in español. Always a good one to check if nothing else works. :wink:

Good Day Everyone,

I am stopping in to see if anyone here may have a solution for what I am trying to achieve in an email that would go out through a workflow. In the mentioned email would be a module that would pull *all* the *active* (custom stage we have set) "deals" associated  with the contact (as some contacts have multiple deals) the email is being sent to.

 I have been told  this _is possible_ with Programmable Email, by using the crm_assocation HubL function to pull in all the deals associated with the contact and then display information for each of those deals.

This is what I have come up with so far in design manager (based on my limited knowledge and examples floating around) , but it seems not to be working...

Any help would be greatly appreciated and if there is somewhere else I should be posting this.

`{% set associated_deals = crm_associations(request.contact.contact_vid, 'HubSpot_DEFINED', 4, 'dealname,cnumber,packagepurchasedate') %}` 

`<div class="deals">`
  `{% for deal in associated_deals.results %}`
  `<div class="deal">`
    `<p>Deal name: {{ deal.dealname }}</p>`
    `<p>Amount: {{ deal.cnumber }}</p>`
    `<p>Purcahse Date: {{ deal.packagepurchasedate }}</p>`
  `</div>`
  `{% endfor %}`  
`</div>`
Let me ask the team.

Hi <@U07DWUGKP4Z>,

HubSpot Serverless Functions are only available for Content Hub Enterprise users.

It's worth noting that you would also get activity logging, conditional data access, custom objects (similar to Operations), the Content Approval stream and team management.
I use neither vpn or adblockers and i’m getting tossed around in other languages unless i’m logged in

Primarily Japanese and Spanish (i think it was)

Hi Manuel, you can attach a video as a link using any major video platform (YT, DailyMotion, Loom etc.) and drop it here if you like or if privacy is a requirement you can send it to someone via direct message. Please note that as with anything public, HubSpot Developers is a community forum and anything you may share with people here who aren't HubSpot staff may be at risk if you are sharing confidential IP.
Ok. Can I sent it to you has a DM?

Ah ok, sorry, I though you were from HubSpot support. Thanks anyway

Hey all, looking for someone to potentially help with a custom Quote template. 

Is it possible to pull in the unit price associated with a specific product, if you're not using the traditional Line Items display on the Quote?

Scenario:
_Building out a custom quote template where I've created tables to display with pricing information if that Product SKU is listed as a line item on the Quote. However, I'm having a hard time figuring out how to append the Unit Price to that, to allow our team to fully customize the pricing if needed._

Is this possible?

Hey <@U07HSC7RJVA>, you're right, this is definitely possible.

The main issue I see with your code right now is that you're passing `request.contact.contact_vid` as the variable that will dictate the contact ID for the HuBL function. That specific variable is used on web pages using Memberships and is populated after a contact logs in (i.e. it's not right for this circumstance)

1. Check these docs <https://developers.HubSpot.com/beta-docs/reference/cms/hubl/functions#crm_associations>
2. Instead, you can just use `contact.hs_object_id`
3. Also, sounds like you want to only return deals in a certain stage. You can do this by adding a filter statement as the 4th argument in the function call. Since you're using a deal stage, you will likely need the internal stage ID in the filter

something like this:
```{% set associated_deals = crm_associations(contact.hs_object_id, 'HubSpot_DEFINED',4,'dealstage=12345', 'dealname,cnumber,packagepurchasedate') %}```
The docs I linked show how to construct the query filter statements
When you're testing, you want to use the "Preview as contact" feature so that it swaps in an example contact to get the data for
Hai
